content.text:
# Schwartz (surname)

Schwartz is a last name of German origin, meaning "black" (modern spelling in German is  ). It was originally a nickname for someone with black hair or a dark complexion. Notable people and characters with the surname include:
*A. R. Schwartz (Aaron Robert Schwartz, 1926–2018), Texas politician
*Abe Schwartz (1881–1963), American Jewish musician
*Al Schwartz, multiple people
*Alba Schwartz (1857–1942), Danish writer
*Allyson Schwartz, former US Representative from Pennsylvania
*Amy Schwartz, multiple people
*Andrea Schwartz (born 1977), Canadian swimmer
*Anna Schwartz (1915–2012), American Jewish economist
*Annetta Schwartz, Romanian Jewish musician
*Anton Schwartz (born 1967), American jazz musician
*Arthur Schwartz, American Jewish composer and film producer (1900–1984)
*Barbara Schwartz (artist) (1949–2006), American artist
*Barry Schwartz (psychologist) (born 1946), American psychologist
*Bernard Schwartz (1925–2010), birth name of American Jewish actor Tony Curtis
*Ben Schwartz (born 1981), American Jewish actor
*Bernard L. Schwartz, American Jewish actor (1925–2024)
*Berthold Schwartz or Swartz, legendary German alchemist of the 14th century, sometimes credited with the invention of gunpowder
*Bill Schwartz, several people
*Buky Schwartz (1932–2009), Israeli sculptor
*Catherine Schwartz (born 1977), American television personality
*Chandra Lee Schwartz (born 1981), American theatre performer
*Christian Friedrich Schwarz (1726–1798), German missionary to India
*David Schwartz, several people
*Danny Schwartz, a police detective in the film Heat portrayed by Jerry Trimble
*Delmore Schwartz (1913–1966), American Jewish poet and short-story writer
*Ed Schwartz (1946–2009), Chicago media personality
*Eddie Schwartz (born 1949), Canadian songwriter and record producer
*Eduard Schwartz (1858–1940), German classical philologist
*Eduardo Schwartz (born 1940), Chilean finance academic
*Edward Joseph Schwartz, American judge
*Elliott Schwartz (1936–2016), American composer
*Evgeny Schwartz (1896–1958), Soviet writer
*Felice Schwartz, American Jewish feminist writer
*Gary Schwartz (disambiguation), several people
*Geoff Schwartz (born 1986), American Jewish NFL football player
*Gerry Schwartz (born 1941), Canadian Jewish businessman
*György Schwartz, aka George Soros (born 1930), Hungarian-American investor and philanthropist
*George X. Schwartz (1915–2010), American politician
*Glenn Schwartz (1940–2018), American musician, member of the band Pacific Gas & Electric
*Gustav Schwartz (1809–1890), Austrian paleontologist
*Hanit Schwartz (born 1987), Israeli women's soccer goalkeeper
*Harry Schwartz, multiple people
*Herbert Schwartz, American college sports coach
*Hillel Schwartz (1923–2007), Egyptian Jewish politician
*Hillel Schwartz (historian) (born 1948), American Jewish cultural historian
*Howard Schwartz (writer and editor), American Jewish folklorist
*Hudson Schwartz (born 2009) American racing driver
*Isaïe Schwartz (1876–1952), great rabbi of France
*Isadore "Corporal Izzy" Schwartz alias "The Ghetto Midget" (1900–1988), American Jewish world champion flyweight boxer
*Jack Schwartz (1930–2009), American mathematician and computer scientist
*Jaden Schwartz (born 1992), Canadian ice hockey player
*Jim Schwartz (born 1966), former NFL head coach, former Defensive Coordinator for the Philadelphia Eagles
*Jean Schwartz (1878–1956), American Jewish songwriter
*Jeffrey H. Schwartz (born 1948), American physical anthropologist
*Jeffrey M. Schwartz, American neuroscientist
*Jerome T. Schwartz (born 1951), American politician
*John Schwartz, several people
*Jonathan Schwartz, several people named Jon or Jonathan
*Joseph Schwartz, multiple people
*Josh Schwartz (born 1976), American writer & producer
*Julius Schwartz (1915–2004), American comic book editor and agent
*Lauren-Marie Taylor (born Lauren Schwartz in 1961), American actress
*Laurent Schwartz (1915–2002), French mathematician
*Lillian Schwartz (1927–2024), American artist
*Lisa Schwartz (born 1983), American author, actress, and YouTube personalty
*Lisa Schwartz (physician) (1963–2018), American Professor of Medicine and Community and Family Medicine at The Dartmouth Institute for Health Policy and Clinical Practice
*Louis B. Schwartz (1913–2003), American law professor at the University of Pennsylvania Law School
*Margaretta Schwartz, Yiddish singer of the late 19th century
*Marie Sophie Schwartz (1819–1894), Swedish novelist
*Melvin Schwartz (1932–2006), American physicist
*Michael Schwartz (disambiguation), several people, including those known as Mike Schwartz
*Morrie Schwartz (1916–1995), American academic and author, subject of the book Tuesdays with Morrie
*Morris Schwartz (1901–2004), American photographer
*Morry Schwartz (born 1948), Australian property developer and publisher
*Murray Schwartz (Queens politician) (1919–2001), New York politician
*Murray Merle Schwartz (1931–2013), US federal judge from Delaware
*Norton A. Schwartz, Chief of Staff of the United States Air Force
*Pedro Schwartz, Spanish economist
*Pepper Schwartz (born 1945), American sociologist and sexologist
*Peter Schwartz, multiple people
*Randal L. Schwartz (born 1961), American computer scientist and technology writer
*Richard Schwartz (disambiguation), several people
*Scott Schwartz (born 1968), American child actor
*Scott L. Schwartz, American actor best known for "The Bruiser" in the ''Ocean's Eleven'' film series
*Seymour I. Schwartz (1928–2020), American physician
*Shalom H. Schwartz, Israeli social psychologist, cross-cultural researcher
*Sherwood Schwartz (1916–2011), American television writer, producer
*Shuki Schwartz (born 1954), Israeli basketball player
*Simon Schwarz (born 1971), Austrian actor
*Simon Schwartz (artist) (born 1982), German illustrator and cartoonist
*Stephen Schwartz (disambiguation), several people
*Tony Schwartz, multiple people
*William C. Schwartz (1927–2000), American laser scientist
*William S. Schwartz (1896–1977), American artist
*William Schwartz (law professor) (1933–2017), American law professor and corporate director
*William Schwartz (physician) (1922–2009), American nephrologist and hospital administrator
